POB-Robotics-Suite Library

v1.O

POB-Robotics-Suite hardware:

The POB-Robotics-Suite is a powerful robot. The electronic, the mechanics and the software allows you to manage sensors, actuator and take action from your program.

The hardware has:

  • 8 ports for your sensor and actuator.
  • each port provide power supply, ground, analog input, digital input/output and i2c bus.
  • 8 servomotor connectors.
  • 1 usb-to-serial.
  • 2 direct current motor.
  • each motor is controlled by speed and provides position by wheel encoder.
  • 2 microcontrollers (each microcontroller is an ARM7TDMI cpu).

Microcontroller Unit:

  • A Microcontroller Unit contains the ARM7 processor, the memory, the flash and the input/output peripherals.
  • A MCU manages the robot behavior likes motor, sensor...
  • The POB-Robotics-Suite is managed by 2 MCU (Microcontroller Unit) named UC1 and UC2.
  • You always develop and program the UC1 microcontroller with the POB-TOOLS or the RISBEE software.
  • The UC2 managed the low level electronics: the 2 dc motor, the 8 servomotors and the wheel encoder. The UC2 comes with a default firmware.
  • Each microcontroller has 8 Kbytes of ram and 32 Kbytes of flash.

Library introduction:

The POB-Robotics-Suite Library provides various functions to use the hardware:

  • Sensor management: light, distance...,
  • Analog input channels: analog functions,
  • Digital input/output pins: input/output functions,
  • Communications protocols: I2C bus and uarts,
  • Motor and Wheel movement: Motors Functions,
  • Servomotor management ( Servomotors),
  • Eeprom storage memory: Eeprom functions,
  • LCD Screen: Lcd functions,
  • Wifi wireless communication: Wifi functions,
  • and various utils functions: timer and clock functions, utils ...

Using the library:

First, You have to install the YAGARTO compiler and the POBTOOLS.

This 2 tools are available on the provided cdrom.

You can copy/paste the next code to test your project settings:

 #include <pobRoboticSuite.h>

int main(void)
{
    // Init robot microcontroller
        InitCpu();
        // Init UART 0 at 115200 baud
        InitUART0(115200);
        // Init robot hardware and discover devices connected on the Pob-Robotics-Suite port
        InitRobot();

        SendString("Hello world from POB-Robotics-Suite!");

        while(1) ;

        return 0;
}
